newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan to streamline foreign investment screening.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan to streamline foreign investment screening.

text.p: Taiwan's Investment Commission said on Tuesday it would streamline its screening and approval procedures on foreign investment, effective immediately.

"To improve the investment environment and boost foreigners' investment willingness, we decided to simplify procedures to shorten the screening time on foreign investment," the commission under the economics ministry said in a statement.

Applications for foreign investment projects whose investments did not include banned or restricted investment items and were below T$200 million and whose investors are not from Hong Kong and Macao will be handled immediately when they are submitted to the commission, it said.
About 80 percent of all foreign investment applications could be streamlined in such a manner, shortening the expected screening and approval time to one to three days, the statement said.
